author: COMSOL
description: This is an example of a simple laser cavity consisting of two spherical mirrors. A ray, initially released at a small angle relative to the optical axis, is traced over a large number of reflections to determine whether it remains confined within the cavity. The study is repeated for several cavity sizes and the stability analysis is then compared to ABCD matrix theory.
label: two_mirror_laser_cavity.mph
name: root

settings.name: commentsinfile
settings.value:
Spherical Mirror 3D

Spherical mirror. The mirror surface may be either concave or convex. A central hole may or may not be present. A clear aperture which is smaller than the mirror surface diameter can be specified.

settings.name: TotalNumberOfDirections
settings.value: Conical distribution contains a total of 331 directions.
